title: Error in: find_outliers_in_raw_data
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Running `find_outliers_in_raw_data` in Google Colab provided notebook for maDLC (https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/examples/COLAB/COLAB_maDLC_TrainNetwork_VideoAnalysis.ipynb) as recommended here (https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/maDLC_UserGuide.html#decision-point) results in a ValueError (see log output) for some videos while others (I have tested 19 different videos) run without issue and extract outlier frames.

No idea whats going on.

### Operating System

Google Colab

### DeepLabCut version

2.2.0.6

### DeepLabCut mode

multi animal

### Device type

gpu in Google Colab

### Steps To Reproduce

deeplabcut.find_outliers_in_raw_data(path_config_file,pickle_file='/content/drive/Shareddrives/Computational_Neuro_IP-AER/Test_maDLC_multi_2/singleanimal-IsabelP-2022-03-24/videos/8-2-2021_Chloroquine_5DLC_dlcrnetms5_singleanimalMar24shuffle1_100000_full.pickle',video_file='/content/drive/Shareddrives/Computational_Neuro_IP-AER/Test_maDLC_multi_2/singleanimal-IsabelP-2022-03-24/videos/8-2-2021_Chloroquine_5.mp4',pcutoff=0.5)

### Relevant log output

```shell
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)

<ipython-input-6-7be94f9a6ed7> in <module>()
----> 1 deeplabcut.find_outliers_in_raw_data(path_config_file,pickle_file='/content/drive/Shareddrives/Computational_Neuro_IP-AER/Test_maDLC_multi_2/singleanimal-IsabelP-2022-03-24/videos/8-2-2021_Chloroquine_5DLC_dlcrnetms5_singleanimalMar24shuffle1_100000_full.pickle',video_file='/content/drive/Shareddrives/Computational_Neuro_IP-AER/Test_maDLC_multi_2/singleanimal-IsabelP-2022-03-24/videos/8-2-2021_Chloroquine_5.mp4',pcutoff=0.5)

2 frames

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/numpy/lib/index_tricks.py in __getitem__(self, key)
    411                 objs[k] = objs[k].astype(final_dtype)
    412 
--> 413         res = self.concatenate(tuple(objs), axis=axis)
    414 
    415         if matrix:

<__array_function__ internals> in concatenate(*args, **kwargs)

ValueError: all the input array dimensions for the concatenation axis must match exactly, but along dimension 0, the array at index 0 has size 2 and the array at index 1 has size 1
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
